intro: Neochilenia acrocarpa, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its low-growing shrub form, with small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Neochilenia acrocarpa is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
